feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 03 at 7:30AM AKST until January 04 at 1:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 1 AM AKST THURSDAY THROUGH THOMPSON PASS... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected. Visibility reduced to one half at times. Northeast winds gusting 25 to 35 mph. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 1 AM AKST Thursday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeast Prince William Sound

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 5:19AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG GUSTY WINDS AND LOCALIZED AREAS OF BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT... Northeasterly winds will continue across the Matanuska Valley through Wednesday evening with gusts reaching as high as 45 mph. These winds are expected to peak by Wednesday evening before slowly diminishing through Thursday morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Matanuska Valley

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR THE HAINES AND SKAGWAY, INCLUDING THE HAINES AND KLONDIKE HIGHWAYS... .A weather system moving into the panhandle will bring increasing snowfall rates to the northern panhandle through the day on Wednesday, with the heaviest rates expected late Wednesday afternoon through Wednesday night. entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway
